content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the rail. From there, move right along the rail, gain the jugs at the face, and work up the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is good, but there are some rocks near the start.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Pumphouse to the left of

Right Side of Average

.

content.description: This is a fun slab climb. Bump up to a crimp, and work up to a sidepull and then two crimps just above the lip.  Work up the feet, there's a nice right foot you can stand on then reach up for the top.
Stand start matched on a jug. From there, campus up through a jug to an edge, reach the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but it does fall away behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Pumphouse's west face.

content.description: Start at a crimp near the bottom of the slope, and traverse up along the lip of the slope using some crimps along the way. Top out to a nice hold further back as you near the top of the slope.
Start at the juggy lip and a little dyno to a sloper. You can move out left from the sloper to nice crimp which helps move the feet up.
content.protection: Pads and spotter are nice. It has a flat landing, but there are some large rocks right behind you.

content.description: This is a pumpy, long traverse that is overhanging for its entire length.
content.location:
Start on the farthest right side of the boulder down past

Right Side of Average

. Traverse right to left all the way to finish on the V4.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the rail. From there, move out to a good edge, match on it, then work through a sidepull and edge to gain a good edge rail, follow to the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: At least a few pads. The landing is good, but there is a rock below the start of the problem.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Pumphouse just left of

Unaweep Collective

.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand crimp. From there, climb the arete and face edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, and there are rocks behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the east side of the boulder's southeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, move up to a sloper shelf, then traverse right through the generous features, reach a pair of diagonal shelfs above, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there are some rocks behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center of Pumphouse's east face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand sloper and a left hand palming the face. From there, pull up to a left hand jug, reach the diagonal shelves above, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the center of Pumphouse's east face.
